item.title: What's the difference between public and private projects?
item.description: Under Project SETTINGS, you have probably seen the Public/Private toggle button.

item.title: Quick intro to Scrum module
item.description: Scrum is an agile framework for developing, delivering, and sustaining complex products.

item.title: Your crash course into Issues Module
item.description: If you’re after a multipurpose and flexible to-do list Taiga module, check Issues.

item.title: What is this Iocaine thing in Taiga and how should I use it?
item.description: Taiga includes optional custom fields in its administration panel. It will provide teams with a flexible input to fit in their workflow.

item.title: What's Taiga's Open Source License?
item.description: There are important considerations governing the Affero GPL license in use by Taiga.

item.title: Can I enjoy partial sprint progress even if user stories are not closed but some tasks are?
item.description: Scrum agile technique states that if an estimated user story is not finished, it can’t be counted towards a sprint’s user story points completion.

item.title: Can I use Taiga in my language?
item.description: Sure! The Taiga community is awesome and helps us translate the Taiga user interface into more than 20 languages.

item.title: How Can I Contribute
item.description: How can I contribute

item.title: Why Taiga?
item.description: This a fair question every agile team should ask themselves. It’s not like there are no options out there, if anything, there are too many project management tools available.

item.title: Customisation
item.description: Page for Customisation Heading 1 Heading 2 Heading 3 Heading 4 Heading 5 Heading 6 Emphasis Emphasis, aka italics, with asterisks or underscores.

item.title: Kanban, the dark side
item.description: This is content that goes a bit beyond Taiga as an Agile platform and tries to convey a self-conscious approach to Kanban.

item.title: Scrum, the dark side
item.description: This is content that goes a bit beyond Taiga as an Agile platform and tries to convey a self-conscious approach to Scrum.

item.title: The 5-min Kanban module overview
item.description: Welcome to a lean method to manage and improve work across human systems, welcome to Kanban.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Page for Getting Started

item.title: Can I add new custom fields to my project?
item.description: Taiga includes optional custom fields in its administration panel. It will provide teams with a flexible input to fit in their workflow.

item.title: Can I transfer the ownership of my blocked tree.taiga.io project?
item.description: Transferring the project ownership of a blocked project might be an unexpected burden to the transferee so we would like to avoid that at all costs.

item.title: Is it possible to cancel my subscription on taiga.io whenever I want?
item.description: Yes, you can cancel at any time. Taiga.io plans are paid monthly or yearly, so if you cancel, once you do so, the plan will run to the end of the period and not renew.

item.title: Who has to pay to use taiga.io?
item.description: Taiga is an Open Source platform. At the same time, we provide a freemium cloud/SaaS offer so you can use our own infrastructure to host all your projects and teams.

item.title: Why is my project blocked on taiga.io?
item.description: We are sorry to hear that. The most probable reason any project would be blocked is because the owner of that project did not subscribe in time to an appropriate paid plan.

item.title: 30min Setup
item.description: This is the easiest and recommended way to run Taiga in production.
